intro: Centaurea ramosa, commonly known as the branched cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea ramosa is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it is considered a common weed in many regions.
